sections.heading: Department of Public Safety created
sections.text:
1-51-1.Department of Public Safety created.

There is hereby created a Department of Public Safety. The head of the Department of Public Safety is the Secretary of Public Safety who shall be appointed and serve pursuant to the provisions of the S. D. Const., Art. IV, §9.

Source:SL 2003, ch 272 (Ex. Ord. 03-1), §18.

sections.heading: Functions of Division of Commercial Inspection and Licensing .
sections.text:
1-51-10. Functions of Division of Commercial Inspection and Licensing.

The Division of Commercial Inspection and Licensing of the Department of Public Safety shall perform:

(1)The functions of the former Division of Consumer Protection pursuant to chapters 34-39, 37-2, 37-20, 37-21, 37-22, 37-22A, 39-1, 39-4, and 39-13; and

(2)The functions of the Department of Agriculture pursuant to chapter 37-21A.

Source:SL 1979, ch 351, §§28 to 32; SL 1979, ch 5, §2; SL 2003, ch 272 (Ex. Ord. 03-1), §87; SL 2004, ch 17, §3; SDCL §1-35-6.2.

sections.heading: Performance by Division of Commercial Inspection and Licensing of heavy scales functions.
sections.text:
1-51-11. Performance by Division of Commercial Inspection and Licensing of heavy scales functions.

The Division of Commercial Inspection and Licensing shall, under the direction and control of the secretary of public safety, perform all the functions of the former heavy scales division of the Public Utilities Commission, created by chapter 37-22.

Source:SL 1973, ch 2, §53; SL 1974, ch 19, §5; SL 2003, ch 272 (Ex. Ord. 03-1), §88; SL 2004, ch 17, §4; SDCL §1-35-7.

sections.heading: Criminal background checks for certain applicants and employees.
sections.text:
1-51-12. Criminal background checks for certain applicants and employees.

Each employee of the Department of Public Safety who performs state inspection services or any person who applies to the department seeking employment performing state inspection services shall submit to a state and federal criminal background investigation by means of fingerprint checks by the Division of Criminal Investigation and the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The secretary of public safety shall submit completed fingerprint cards to the Division of Criminal Investigation for the applicant or employee. Upon completion of the state and federal criminal background investigation, the Division of Criminal Investigation shall forward to the secretary all information obtained as a result of the investigation.

The applicant or employee is responsible for any fee charged for the cost of fingerprinting or the criminal background investigation. The department may pay any fee charged for the cost of fingerprinting or the criminal background investigation for any person whose employment is subject to the requirements of this section.

Source:SL 2019, ch 12, §1.
